p: The maturation stage of the fruit can be determined by changes in the color and texture of the fruit peel and flesh. Raw mango is generally green in color, changing to yellow or orange when fully ripe. The color change depends on the type of cultivar, and can also be an indicator of the quality of the fruit. There are several pigments, including chlorophylls, carotenoids, and flavonoids, that are responsible for the change in the color and metabolism of the mango fruit [ 58].
